description: This file appears to be a Python source file that defines functions for emitting C++ code related to JSON-RPC communication, including registering and unregistering methods and events, as well as generating interface code. The code is involved in code generation, not regular application logic.

methods.name: EmitEvent(emit, root, event, params_type, legacy = False)
methods.description: Generates C++ code for emitting a JSON-RPC event, including function signature and body for notifying events.

methods.name: _EmitRpcPrologue(root, emit, header_file, source_file, ns, data_emitted, prototypes = [])
methods.description: Emits the prologue part of the RPC code, including headers, namespace declarations, and version info.

methods.name: _EmitRpcEpilogue(root, emit, ns)
methods.description: Emits the epilogue part of the RPC code, closing namespaces and performing cleanup.

methods.name: _EmitVersionCode(emit, version)
methods.description: Emits C++ namespace with version constants.

methods.name: _EmitRpcCode(root, emit, ns, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Main function to generate full RPC interface code, including registration functions and event handlers.

methods.name: EmitRpcCode(root, emit, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Wrapper that generates the complete RPC code and prepends prototypes.

methods.name: EmitRpcVersionCode(root, emit, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Generates version info and main RPC structure code.

methods.name: _Invoke(params, response, use_prefix = True, const_cast = False, parent = "", repsonse_parent = "")
